Articles.Content:
As you can tell from the title, my name is Indy and, like several other people here, I bought Kerbal Space Program on the Summer Steam Sale. To my defense, however, I've been eyeing KSP for about a year now, but never really had the incentive to get it.

But now that I won it, this is literally the only game I have played since acquiring it. I LOVE this game.

So yeah, Hi. I'm Indy. As for any noteworthy accomplishments, I watched all of Scott Manly's vids, skipped going to Mun and went straight for Minmus, and I can't dock anything in space. Woo!
Hello Indy, and welcome to the forum.

Woohoo!

Welcome to the forums! There are plenty of places to crash...err, I mean browse around here.

Hi Indy, I got this account for the forums yesterday, Yay!

By the way, Jeb is BOSS
"We named the dog Indiana.." Welcome Indy. Use the forum like a learning experience. Blow stuff up, come hear and ask an expert why.

Hi Indy, I got this account for the forums yesterday, Yay!

By the way, Jeb is BOSS

http://static3.fjcdn.com/thumbnails/comments/Jebediah+Kerman+_9c60748e160c81fa6cafc3d9c9eae5d7.jpg

I have always loved Crazy-eyes Jebodiah. He's my primary pilot.

Hi Indy Welcome to the wonderful world of KSP. yes it's a life changing experience when you get into it. Keep practising docking it's great when you can do it without a hitch. I've just about mastered it now but still hit F5 before I attempt to dock and sometimes have to load my quicksave to recover. Look forward to seeing some pictures.
